ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.dataClasses

Class Chapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.dataClasses.Chapter

  • public class Chapter
extends java.lang.Object
    Role: A container to hold chapter information. This includes id, story id, text, choices, illustrations and photos. Note that all id's are stored as UUID's. A chapter will always belong to a specific story, and no chapter can belong to more than one story.
    Author:
    Ashley Brown, Stephanie Gil

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chapter

        public Chapter(java.util.UUID storyId,
       java.lang.String text)
        Initializes a new chapter object without needing to specify its id. A new Id will be randomly generated once the object is created. By default, the randomChoice boolean will be set to false, so you would have to use the setRandomChoice() method to set it to true.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "text");
        Parameters:
        storyId - The id of the story the chapter belongs to. Must be a UUID.
        text - The chapter text that the user will be reading. Must be a string.

      • Chapter

        public Chapter(java.util.UUID id,
       java.util.UUID storyId,
       java.lang.String text)
        Initialize a new chapter while needing to specify an id. This is used to make a chapter object that will be holding search criteria.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), UUID.randomUUID(), "text");
        Parameters:
        id - The unique id of the chapter. Must be a UUID.
        storyId - The id of the story the chapter is from
        text - The chapter text that the user will be reading

      • Chapter

        public Chapter(java.util.UUID id,
       java.util.UUID storyId,
       java.lang.String text,
       java.lang.Boolean randomChoice)
        Initialize a new chapter with an id. This is always used when making a chapter from data just retrieved from the database. Can also be used to make a chapter that will hold search criteria. This constructor also expects the randomChoice parameter specifying whether or not a random choice should be used when viewing it.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), UUID.randomUUID(), "text", true);
        Parameters:
        id - The unique id of the chapter. Must be a UUID.
        storyId - The id of the story the chapter is from. Must be a UUID.
        text - The chapter text that the user will be reading
        randomChoice - A flag to indicate whether or not the chapter should display a random choice when reading it or not.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public java.util.UUID getId()
        Returns the id of the chapter as a UUID.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "text");
        UUID id = chap.getId(); System.out.println(id);

        Output would be something like: "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7"

      • getStoryId

        public java.util.UUID getStoryId()
        Returns the story id the media belongs to as a UUID.

        Example:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "text");
        UUID storyId = chap.getStoryId();
        System.out.println(storyId);

        Output would be something like: "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7"

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns the text of the chapter as a string.

        Example:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "text");
        String text = chap.getText();
        System.out.println(text);

        Output would be: "text"

      • hasRandomChoice

        public java.lang.Boolean hasRandomChoice()
        Returns true if the chapter should display a random choice, and false if it shouldn't. By default, it is set to false.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "text");
        Boolean bool = chap.hasRandomChoice();
        System.out.println(bool.toString());

        output would be: "false"

      • getChoices

        public java.util.ArrayList<Choice> getChoices()
        Returns the choices of the chapter as an array list. If the chapter has no choices, an empty array list is returned.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "text");
        ArrayList choices = chap.getChoices();

      • getPhotos

        public java.util.ArrayList<Media> getPhotos()
        Returns the photos of the chapter as an array list. If the chapter has no photos, an empty array list is returned.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "text");
        ArrayList choices = chap.getPhotos();

      • getIllustrations

        public java.util.ArrayList<Media> getIllustrations()
        Returns the illustrations of the chapter as an array list. If the chapter has no illustrations, an empty array list is returned.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "text");
        ArrayList choices = chap.getIllustrations();

      • setId

        public void setId(java.util.UUID id)
        Sets the Id of the chapter. The new Id provided must be a UUID.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "text");
        UUID id = UUID.randomUUID();
        chap.setId(id);
        Parameters:
        id - New chapter id. Must be a UUID or null.

      • setStoryId

        public void setStoryId(java.util.UUID id)
        Sets the Id of the story the chapter belongs to. The new Id provided must be a UUID.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "text");
        UUID id = UUID.randomUUID();
        chap.setStoryId(id);
        Parameters:
        id - New story id. Must be a UUID or null.

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the text of the chapter, which is what the user will read when they are viewing a chapter. Example "on a dark cold night, you found a house."

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "");
        chap.setText("And so the man took the shovel with him to finish it);
        Parameters:
        text - The text of the chapter that the user will read

      • setRandomChoice

        public void setRandomChoice(java.lang.Boolean randomChoice)
        Sets the random choice flag of the chapter. Will either be true or false. By default, on the creation of a chapter it is set to false. If it is true, a random choice will be displayed when viewing a chapter. This choice will link to a chapter one of the other choices displayed links to, and will decide which one to link to randomly.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "");
        chap.setText("And so the man took the shovel with him to finish it);
        Parameters:
        randomChoice - Boolean to decided whether or not to display a random choice.

      • setChoices

        public void setChoices(java.util.ArrayList<Choice> choices)
        Sets the choices of the chapter (where the choices are in an array list). It should never be passed in null.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "");
        chap.setChoices(new ArrayList());
        Parameters:
        choices - The choices that link this chapter to another. This must be in the form of an ArrayList of choices and should never be null.

      • setPhotos

        public void setPhotos(java.util.ArrayList<Media> photos)
        Sets the photos of the chapter (where the photos are in an array list). It should never be passed in null.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "");
        chap.setPhotos(new ArrayList());
        Parameters:
        photos - The photos of the chapter (can be posted by other users as well, may contain text comments, and can only be added when reading a chapter).

      • setIllustrations

        public void setIllustrations(java.util.ArrayList<Media> illustrations)
        Sets the illustrations of the chapter (where the photos are in an array list). It should never be passed in null.

        Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "");
        chap.setillustrations(new ArrayList());
        Parameters:
        illustrations - The illustrations of the chapter (don't contain text comments and are only added when editing a chapter).
